headline: Expand Energy, formerly Chesapeake, to move headquarters out of Oklahoma City
summary: Expand Energy, formerly Chesapeake Energy, is moving its headquarters to Houston by mid-2026, but promises its 500 OKC employees will remain.

content.title: Expand Energy, formerly Chesapeake, to move headquarters out of Oklahoma City
content.summary: Expand Energy, formerly Chesapeake Energy, is moving its headquarters to Houston by mid-2026, but promises its 500 OKC employees will remain.

thumbnail.caption: Exterior additions and new entrances are shown at Building 15 at the former Chesapeake Energy campus that is being renovated as the consolidated headquarters for Expand Energy, which replaced Chesapeake Energy in 2024.

headline: The Devon-Coterra Merger: 7 Key Questions Answered
summary: Devon Energy Corp. (NYSE: DVN) announced an all-stock merger with Coterra Energy Inc. (NYSE: CTRA) on February 2, creating a $58 billion energy giant. The deal has sparked plenty of investor questions about what it means for DVN stock and its dividend. Here are the seven most important questions investors are asking — and the answers you need. 1. What Happens to the Devon Energy Dividend After the Merger? This is the top question on every income investor’s mind.InvestorPlace - Stock Market News,
